insights.title: Purchase volume lagging industry
insights.observation: Your total quantity purchased in the last 90 days is 12,913 units, which is 32% below the industry average of 19,097 units for the same period.
insights.recommendation: Review demand forecasting and consolidate orders to increase volume. Consider bulk purchasing agreements to drive up order quantities and improve unit pricing.

insights.title: Supplier count far above industry norm
insights.observation: You sourced from 10 distinct suppliers, 170% more than the industry average of 3.7 suppliers per period. This expands management overhead and increases coordination risk.
insights.recommendation: Implement a supplier rationalization program: qualify additional strategic vendors, but also set clear criteria to prune low‑value suppliers and streamline procurement processes.

insights.title: High spend concentration on a single supplier
insights.observation: 60% of your total spend (≈ $34.96 M) went to Tarsons Products Limited, while the industry’s average spend per supplier is about $17.8 M. This creates a critical dependency risk despite having many suppliers.
insights.recommendation: Negotiate better terms with Tarsons and simultaneously develop alternative sources for the same product line to reduce reliance on a single vendor.

insights.title: Rapid turnover of new suppliers
insights.observation: 9 out of your 10 active suppliers (90%) are new in the current period, indicating a very high churn rate compared with typical buyer stability.
insights.recommendation: Introduce a formal supplier onboarding and performance‑tracking framework to retain high‑performing partners and reduce unnecessary turnover.

insights.title: Average spend per supplier well below benchmark
insights.observation: Your average spend per supplier is $5.8 M, which is 67% lower than the industry benchmark of roughly $17.8 M per supplier.
insights.recommendation: Consolidate spend with existing high‑performing suppliers to achieve economies of scale and improve negotiating leverage.

insights.title: Category spend heavily skewed to Cryosurgery equipment
insights.observation: Cryosurgery equipment or accessories represent 47% of your total spend ($27.46 M of $58.05 M). Such concentration can expose you to price volatility and supply risk.
insights.recommendation: Conduct a category‑wide spend analysis, explore alternative suppliers or substitute products, and negotiate multi‑year contracts to mitigate risk.
